comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From the Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:JOSEPH, STEWART HUGH
Initials:S H
Nationality:United Kingdom
Rank:Major
Regiment/Service:Royal Engineers
Unit Text:Cdg. 227th Field Coy.
Age:23
Date of Death:18/08/1917
Additional information:Son of Henry Hope Joseph, of 112, Belgrave Rd., London, and the late Helen Christina Joseph (nee Porter).
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:I. G. 5.
Cemetery:VOORMEZEELE ENCLOSURES No.1 and No.2

comment.author: 8498561@N08
comment._content:
Major Stewart Hugh Joseph
Stewart Hugh Joseph was born Hong Kong 1894, the only son of Henry Hope Joseph and Helen Christina Joseph (nee Porter) (parents wed in Shanghai 2nd Apr 1888, mother died before 1901).
Stewart’s father Henry was a manager for the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company, which presumably was the reason the family lived in China and Hong Kong.

Having returned to England with his father, Stewart grew up in Paddington, London (1901 address 40 Gloucester Gardens, Paddington).  In 1901 Henry and his son Stewart shared their home with Henry’s sister Jessie, and three servants and in 1909 Henry married once more,  Louisa Mary Beauchamp becoming the 13 year old Stewart’s step-mother.

Mentioned in Dispatches London Gazette 01/01/1916 (page 24), 04/07/1917 (page 197), and 11/12/1917 (page 12915)
